tldr: The authors conducted a detailed study on the self-inhibition of neopentane pyrolysis at small extents of reaction. They found that the reaction is both homogeneous and strongly self-inhibited, with the pyrolysis being entirely free radical in character. The mechanism is based on a simple Rice-Herzfeld scheme, and self-inhibition is associated with the presence of isobutene. This research provides a better understanding of the early stages of the reaction and the role of self-inhibition in neopentane pyrolysis.
